tasks.title: 🐛 CRITICAL: Blog Schema Error beheben
tasks.description: Database Error: column blogs.is_public does not exist
tasks.details:
**DevTools Finding: Console Error**
❌ Direct blogs query error: column blogs.is_public does not exist

**COMPLETED ✅**

**What was done:**
1. ✅ Removed `.eq('is_public', true)` from getBlogsDirect()
2. ✅ Removed `.eq('is_public', true)` from getBlogDirect()
3. ✅ Added comments explaining removal
4. ✅ Tested in browser - NO MORE ERROR!

**Results:**
- Console error completely gone ✅
- Blog queries now work without is_public column
- Ready to load blogs when data exists

**Files Changed:**
- ✅ lib/supabase.ts (2 functions updated)

**Note:**
Blog section still shows "keine Artikel verfügbar" because no blog data exists in database yet. This is expected behavior, not an error.

tasks.title: 🐛 React Key Warning in Kids Ascension Images

tasks.details:

1. ✅ Added unique keys: key={`${imageAlt}-${imageIndex}-${index}`}
2. ✅ Keys now include: alt text + image index + loop index
3. ✅ No more React warnings for Ticker components

**Note:**
Remaining React key warning kommt von anderem Component (CourseCardModern in different context)

tasks.title: ⚡ Render Blocking Requests optimieren
tasks.description: DevTools Insight: Render-blocking resources verzögern FCP/LCP
tasks.details:
**DevTools Performance Insight:**
Render-blocking requests verzögern initial page render

**Current Render-Blocking Resources:**
- CSS Files (layout.css)
- Font Files (8+ woff2 files)
- Critical JavaScript

**Optimizations:**

1. **Critical CSS Inline:**
   - Extract above-the-fold CSS
   - Inline critical styles in <head>
   - Defer non-critical CSS

2. **Font Loading Strategy:**
   - Use font-display: swap
   - Preload critical fonts
   - Subset fonts (nur benötigte Zeichen)

3. **JavaScript:**
   - Defer non-critical scripts
   - Split vendor bundles
   - Code splitting by route

4. **Next.js Optimization:**
   - Enable experimental optimizeCss
   - Review next.config.js
   - Implement ISR where possible

**Files:**
- next.config.js
- app/layout.tsx
- tailwind.config.ts

tasks.title: 💾 Caching Strategy implementieren
tasks.description: DevTools Insight: Lange Cache Lifetime für bessere Performance
tasks.details:
**DevTools Performance Insight:**
"A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits"

**Current State:**
- Keine spezifischen Cache Headers
- Standard Next.js Caching
- Supabase Assets ohne optimale Cache

**Caching Strategy:**

1. **Static Assets:**
   - Images: Cache-Control: public, max-age=31536000
   - Fonts: Cache-Control: public, max-age=31536000
   - CSS/JS: Cache-Control: public, max-age=31536000

2. **Supabase Storage:**
   - Custom CDN mit Cache Headers
   - Or: Vercel Image Optimization

3. **API Routes:**
   - Courses: ISR, revalidate every 1h
   - Blogs: ISR, revalidate every 15min
   - User Data: No cache

4. **Next.js Config:**
   - Enable SWC
   - Optimize images
   - Set revalidate times

5. **Service Worker (Optional):**
   - Offline support
   - Cache-first strategy
   - PWA features

**Implementation:**
- next.config.js: headers() config
- Vercel.json: Cache headers
- ISR für static pages

**Expected Impact:**
- Faster repeat visits
- Reduced bandwidth
- Better Lighthouse score

tasks.title: 🗄️ Ablefy Migration - Implementation
tasks.description: Ablefy Daten nach Supabase importieren (Schema ist ready!)
tasks.details:
**Prerequisites:** ✅ Task 6 completed (Schema ready)

**Implementation Steps:**

1. **Run Migrations:**
   - Execute transactions table migration
   - Execute orders table migration
   - Execute course_mapping table migration
   - Verify tables created

2. **Populate course_mapping:**
   - Fetch from Airtable course_mapping table
   - Map product_id → course_id
   - Insert into Supabase
   - Validate mappings

3. **Import Orders:**
   - Fetch ~13k orders from Airtable
   - Transform to Supabase schema
   - Batch insert (100 per batch)
   - Set source='ablefy', account_type='old'
   - Map course_id via course_mapping

4. **Import Transactions:**
   - Fetch ~20k transactions from Airtable
   - Transform to Supabase schema
   - Link to orders via order_number
   - Batch insert
   - Set source_platform='ablefy'

5. **Validate Import:**
   - Count records: Airtable vs Supabase
   - Sum amounts: should match
   - Check all orders have transactions
   - Check all transactions have orders
   - Verify course mappings

6. **Create Test Users:**
   - Pick 5 sample buyer emails
   - Create auth.users
   - Link orders → users
   - Test access derivation

**Success Criteria:**
- Zero data loss
- All relationships intact
- Access derivation works
- Ready for Stripe parallel operation

**Estimated Time:** 4-6 hours

**Dependencies:**
- Airtable API access
- Supabase service key
- N8N for automation (optional)

**Files:**
- Run: supabase/migrations/*.sql
- Execute: scripts/import-ablefy-transactions.js
- Test: Create test users & verify access
